project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Cyclone Emergency Recovery Project are to assist the government of Samoa to recover from the damage caused by Cyclone Heta and reduce the vulnerability of its people to prevailing natural hazards through: (a) Recovery of coastal resilience to erosion, flooding, and landslide hazards through appropriate and sustainable use of structural and non-structural protection; (b) Nurturing the recovery of fragile coastal ecosystems through sustainable practices; and (c) Rehabilitation of damaged land transport communications. The main benefits are increased resilience to natural hazards of social infrastructure in the coastal areas at highest risk. Also access to emergency relief will be more reliable in the event of a future disaster. Arrangements for procurement, financial management, and implementation address the fiduciary risks of the project.
